**Gray dragon scale mail**, also known as **grey dragon scale mail** and abbreviated as **GDSM**, is a type of [body armor](/wiki/Body_armor "Body armor") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is made of [dragon hide](/wiki/Dragon_hide "Dragon hide") like all [dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail").

## Generation

Gray dragon scale mail is not randomly generated. Reading a non-cursed [scroll of enchant armor](/wiki/Scroll_of_enchant_armor "Scroll of enchant armor") that targets worn [gray dragon scales](/wiki/Gray_dragon_scales "Gray dragon scales") will convert them into mail, with a blessed scroll adding a point of [enchantment](/wiki/Enchantment "Enchantment").

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") that are not [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)") generated on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") have a 1⁄9 chance of [generating with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") gray dragon scale mail as their initial body armor before role-specific replacements.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

While worn, gray dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance"). Uncontrolled [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") while wearing gray dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a [gray dragon](/wiki/Gray_dragon "Gray dragon"), though in practice only [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph") or [zapping](/wiki/Zapping "Zapping") a [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") at yourself will do this.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Strategy

- *Main article: [Dragon scale mail](/wiki/Dragon_scale_mail "Dragon scale mail")*

Gray dragon scale mail is one of the two most coveted types of dragon scale mail, with the other being [silver dragon scale mail](/wiki/Silver_dragon_scale_mail "Silver dragon scale mail"). Magic resistance is also a very rare property outside of [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") sources, naturally making it a good first [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for many characters and a popular item in [ascension kits](/wiki/Ascension_kit "Ascension kit") - it is usually combined with an [amulet](/wiki/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection"), [shield](/wiki/Shield_of_reflection "Shield of reflection") or other non-body armor source of [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection").

In terms of advantages as a candidate for wishes or ascension kits, gray dragon scale mail keeps the cloak slot open to be used for a source of [MC3](/wiki/MC3 "MC3") if so desired, and protects a character against [teleport traps](/wiki/Teleport_trap "Teleport trap"), [level teleporters](/wiki/Level_teleporter "Level teleporter"), [polymorph traps](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap"), and [monster spells](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") cast by vicious spellcasters. Reflection is also somewhat easier to obtain without wishing compared to magic resistance, though an early series of wishes (e.g. usually a lucky [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing")) can remove this factor, leaving it more up to a player's desired character build and their character's capabilities.

### Perks versus silver DSM

- *Main article: [GDSM versus SDSM](/wiki/GDSM_versus_SDSM "GDSM versus SDSM")*

Characters that cannot [twoweapon](/wiki/Twoweapon "Twoweapon") will lean towards gray dragon scale mail, especially if they either do not care about [spellcasting](/wiki/Spellcasting "Spellcasting") or are fine with taking off a shield to cast outside of combat (though doing so with a shield of reflection is risky). Characters who can twoweapon, want their cloak slot free and/or do not plan to wear an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving") as their primary amulet may also consider gray dragon scale mail; characters in roles whose [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") pits them against a spellcasting [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") or many spell-casting quest monsters may also prefer it. Chaotic-aligned characters in particular cannot obtain magic resistance by wishing for a [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), though there is the rare [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk") character that may be willing to brave [their quest](/wiki/Monk_quest "Monk quest") for [the Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/The_Eyes_of_the_Overworld "The Eyes of the Overworld"), and chaotic [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") can usually [sacrifice](/wiki/Sacrifice "Sacrifice") for [Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane") (which other chaotic roles can wish for, if they are willing to deal with the blasting damage).

Magic resistance on its own does not protect against elemental damage, especially from wands and breath weapons: [crowning](/wiki/Crowning "Crowning") can cover most of these weaknesses save for [acid](/wiki/Acid "Acid") and [disintegration](/wiki/Disintegration "Disintegration"), though the latter danger does not occur until deep into the dungeon. Additionally, several types of monster spell can only be cast in melee range, making it possible to use [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") and other tools to keep casters from closing in while bringing them down at a distance, albeit to a limited extent. Wizards start the game with a cloak of magic resistance, and can obtain Magicbane unless observing a conduct that would forbid it (e.g. [atheist](/wiki/Atheist "Atheist") or artifactless), making gray scale mail typically redundant for them.

While the more dangerous spells are generally encountered far deeper in the dungeon and possibly within the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest"), including [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") monsters that can warp to you directly, they can also appear much earlier, due to polymorph traps and [shapeshifters](/wiki/Shapeshifter "Shapeshifter") like [chameleons](/wiki/Chameleon "Chameleon") that polymorph at random - this in part can push a character in favor of gray dragon mail, particularly as an aid for both stepping on polymorph traps and fighting some of the monsters they can create. A player with a character that has not yet cleared [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") may opt to wish for gray dragon scale mail and take their chances with finding reflection inside the branch or elsewhere in the dungeon.

## History

Gray dragon scale mail first appears with most other colors of dragon scale mail in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"). From NetHack 3.0.0 to [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), including variants based on those versions, gray dragon scale mail is created by polymorphing the corpse of a gray dragon. Gray dragon scales are introduced in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0"), along with the current method for converting them into dragon scale mail.

## Variants

- *Main article: [Dragon-scaled armor](/wiki/Dragon-scaled_armor "Dragon-scaled armor")*

In some variants, dragon scale mail is phased out in favor of dragon-scaled armor, whose implementation is based on a proposal by dtsund. Instead of being made into mail of its own, dragon scales are treated as a [cloak](/wiki/Cloak "Cloak"), and reading a scroll of enchant armor melds them onto a worn set of body armor, generally augmenting that armor by adding its AC and conferred extrinsic properties to it. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

Some variants also give gray dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of gray dragon scale armor - due to already being a powerful item, they may be less commonly given properties compared to other colors. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [object properties](/wiki/Object_properties "Object properties") may also make other colors of dragon mail more worthwhile.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), gray dragon scale mail is potentially available to all characters:

- The [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") has a set of cursed -9 gray dragon scales.
- The black market proprietor [One-eyed Sam](/wiki/Black_market_\(SLASH%27EM\)#One-eyed_Sam "Black market (SLASH'EM)") is always generated with gray dragon scale mail.

Both are quite difficult to obtain, with One-Eyed Sam in particular being a massive obstacle for even the most daring players. The dragon scales in the Lawful Quest are on the same square as a [statue trap](/wiki/Statue_trap "Statue trap") of an [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich"), which is an incredibly troublesome monster in its own right - this also introduces several means of circumventing the trap, though most characters will still want a means of significantly boosting the scales' enchantment prior to making mail of them (with [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation") being among the most reliable).

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), gray dragon scale mail is one of the few dragon mails to not confer additional properties while worn.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") in each game - to [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [scroll of identify](/wiki/Scroll_of_identify "Scroll of identify") on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a wand of wishing can create dragon scale mail directly.

Gray dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by **magic dragon scale mail**, which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Dragon armor (dNetHack)](/wiki/Dragon_armor_\(dNetHack\) "Dragon armor (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), worn gray dragon scale mail additionally confers [half spell damage](/wiki/Half_spell_damage "Half spell damage").

The [leader of the rebel party](/wiki/Rebel_leader "Rebel leader") that makes up the [Noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble")'s quest nemesis for the default [Noble quest](/wiki/Noble_quest "Noble quest") always generates with gray dragon scale mail.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), gray dragon scale mail is one of the few dragon mails to not confer additional properties while worn, as in SporkHack. It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn).

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, the [Scales of the Dragon Lord](/index.php?title=Scales_of_the_Dragon_Lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Scales of the Dragon Lord (page does not exist)") is an artifact set of gray dragon scale mail that can always be found in [The Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves"), where the [Dragon Lord](/index.php?title=Dragon_Lord\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon Lord (page does not exist)") drops it and his corpse upon death.

## References

2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/polyself.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 501](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/polyself.c#L501)

While worn, gray dragon scale mail confers 9 base AC and magic resistance. Uncontrolled polymorph while wearing gray dragon scale mail will revert them to scales and turn the wearer into a gray dragon, though in practice only quaffing a potion of polymorph or zapping a wand of polymorph at yourself will do this.[2][3]

Main article: Dragon scale mail

Magic resistance is also a very rare property outside of artifact sources, naturally making it a good first wish for many characters and a popular item in ascension kits - it is usually combined with an amulet, shield or other non-body armor source of reflection.

In terms of advantages as a candidate for wishes or ascension kits, gray dragon scale mail keeps the cloak slot open to be used for a source of MC3 if so desired, and protects a character against teleport traps, level teleporters, polymorph traps, and monster spells cast by vicious spellcasters. Reflection is also somewhat easier to obtain without wishing compared to magic resistance, though an early series of wishes (e.g. usually a lucky wand of wishing) can remove this factor, leaving it more up to a player's desired character build and their character's capabilities.

Magic resistance on its own does not protect against elemental damage, especially from wands and breath weapons: crowning can cover most of these weaknesses save for acid and disintegration, though the latter danger does not occur until deep into the dungeon. Dragon-scaled armor is implemented in [[NetHack Fourk]], [[xNetHack]], [[EvilHack]], and [[Hack'EM]]. Some variants also give gray dragon scale mail additional properties while worn, and may even introduce other forms of gray dragon scale armor - due to already being a powerful item, they may be less commonly given properties compared to other colors. Variants that implement partial intrinsics and/or [[object properties]] may also make other colors of dragon mail more worthwhile. ===SLASH'EM=== In [[SLASH'EM]], gray dragon scale mail is potentially available to all characters: * The [[Lawful Quest]] has a set of cursed -9 gray dragon scales. * The black market proprietor [[Black market (SLASH'EM)#One-eyed Sam|One-eyed Sam]] is always generated with gray dragon scale mail. Both are quite difficult to obtain, with One-Eyed Sam in particular being a massive obstacle for even the most daring players. The dragon scales in the Lawful Quest are on the same square as a [[statue trap]] of an [[arch-lich]], which is an incredibly troublesome monster in its own right - this also introduces several means of circumventing the trap, though most characters will still want a means of significantly boosting the scales' enchantment prior to making mail of them (with [[cancellation]] being among the most reliable). ===SporkHack=== In [[SporkHack]], gray dragon scale mail is one of the few dragon mails to not confer additional properties while worn. ===UnNetHack=== In [[UnNetHack]], dragon scales and dragon scale mail have randomized powers and [[Randomized appearance|appearances]] in each game - to [[wish]] for dragon armor or scales by its corresponding power, either type of armor must be formally identified first, e.g. by using a [[scroll of identify]] on dropped dragon scales (which identifies the matching scale mail along with it) or by witnessing the dragon use its breath weapon. Only wishes from a wand of wishing can create dragon scale mail directly. Gray dragon scale mail is effectively replaced by '''magic dragon scale mail''', which confers only 5 base AC like all dragon scale mail in UnNetHack. ===dNetHack=== {{main|Dragon armor (dNetHack)}} In [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]], worn gray dragon scale mail additionally confers [[half spell damage]]. The [[Rebel leader|leader of the rebel party]] that makes up the [[Noble]]'s quest nemesis for the default [[Noble quest]] always generates with gray dragon scale mail. ===FIQHack=== In [[FIQHack]], gray dragon scale mail is one of the few dragon mails to not confer additional properties while worn, as in SporkHack. It also weighs 300 aum like all dragon scale mail in FIQHack (which is halved while worn). ===SlashTHEM=== In [[SlashTHEM]], in addition to SLASH'EM details, the [[Scales of the Dragon Lord]] is an artifact set of gray dragon scale mail that can always be found in [[The Wyrm Caves]], where the [[Dragon Lord]] drops it and his corpse upon death. ==References== {{nethack-367}} [[Category:Dragon armor]]
